definition: disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration

sentences.english: Holding crossbows and arrows and other long-distance shooting weapons, they took up the job of defending the whole battle formation.
sentences.chinese: 他們手執弓弩等遠射兵器，擔任整個軍陣的警戒任務。

sentences.english: The Austrian trenches were above on the hillside only a few yards from the Italian lines.
sentences.chinese: 奧軍的戰壕就挖在山坡上，距離意軍陣地只有數碼遠。

sentences.english: Yossi Benayoun and Nicolas Anelka will also be part of the Blues' squad that day.
sentences.chinese: 尤西貝納永和阿內爾卡也會是那天藍軍陣容中的一員。

sentences.english: With the Macedonian cavalry engaged on both flanks, Alexander sends his phalanxes straight into the center of the Persian lines.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山大派遣方陣，長驅直入波斯軍陣列的中央。

sentences.english: Let's go to have a close look at an ancient Chinese array of troops.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們去近觀一下中國古代軍陣。

sentences.english: It's fascinating to see how ancient Chinese troops were arrayed.
sentences.chinese: 參觀中國古代軍陣是很吸引人的。

definition: to fight with all one's might
to evaluate the merit of sth
Vertical Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
lit. a thunder of dragons without a head/fig. a group lacking a leader
nickname of Han dynasty general Li Guang 李廣|李广[Li3 Guang3]
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
General Yuchi Gong (585-658), famous military man instrumental in founding the Tang dynasty
